support_summary: Following the initial cleavage by S1P, Site-2 Protease (S2P/MBTPS2) performs a second proteolytic cut to release the active ATF6 transcription factor domain.

functions.cellular_process: Following the initial cleavage by S1P in the Golgi, Site-2 Protease (S2P/MBTPS2) performs a second cleavage within the transmembrane domain of the ATF6 intermediate.
functions.effect_description: S2P performs the final intramembrane cleavage of the ATF6 intermediate, releasing the active N-terminal transcription factor domain into the cytoplasm.
biological_consequence: S1P-cleaved ATF6 intermediate is recognized by S2P in the Golgi → S2P performs intramembrane proteolysis of the ATF6 transmembrane domain → The cytosolic ATF6-N fragment is released from the membrane → ATF6-N translocates to the nucleus to act as a transcription factor.

Nuclear ATF6-N binds to ER Stress Response Elements (ERSEs) in gene promoters → Expression of UPR target genes (e.g., BiP, GRP94, XBP1) is upregulated → ER protein folding and degradation capacity is increased → ER homeostasis is restored.
specific_effects: Performs regulated intramembrane proteolysis on the S1P-processed ATF6 fragment.
The release of the ATF6-N fragment is completely dependent on prior S1P cleavage.
Cleavage is blocked in cells lacking S2P.

evidence.paper_title: ER stress induces cleavage of membrane-bound ATF6 by the same proteases that process SREBPs
evidence.authors: J Ye, R B Rawson, R Komuro, X Chen, U P Davé, R Prywes, M S Brown, J L Goldstein
evidence.relevant_quote: ATF6 processing was blocked completely in cells lacking S2P and partially in cells lacking S1P.

evidence.paper_title: Dependence of site-2 protease cleavage of ATF6 on prior site-1 protease digestion is determined by the size of the luminal domain of ATF6
evidence.relevant_quote: The release of the cytosolic transcription factor domain of ATF6 requires the sequential processing by the Golgi site-1 and site-2 proteases (S1P and S2P).

evidence.paper_title: Understanding the Unfolded Protein Response (UPR) Pathway: Insights into Neuropsychiatric Disorders and Therapeutic Potentials
evidence.relevant_quote: ATF6 translocates to the Golgi apparatus upon ER stress, where it is cleaved by site-1 protease (S1P) and site-2 protease (S2P), releasing a cytosolic fragment that functions as a transcription factor.

mechanism: Following the initial cleavage by S1P in the Golgi, Site-2 Protease (S2P/MBTPS2) performs a second cleavage within the transmembrane domain of the ATF6 intermediate.
effect: S2P performs the final intramembrane cleavage of the ATF6 intermediate, releasing the active N-terminal transcription factor domain into the cytoplasm.
summary: ATF6 activates S2P to modulate atf6 proteolytic cleavage (site-2), ultimately affecting atf6-n translocates to the nucleus to act as a transcription factor.
